PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The polymer PDTP-DT2BT exhibits the highest PCE of 3.12% , ascribed to the largest J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 with a slightly lower V OC of 0.54 V and a slightly higher FF of 0.57 than the other polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| FF |

These entities are properties mentioned in the context of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT. PCE stands for power conversion efficiency, J SC is short for short-circuit current density, V OC refers to open-circuit voltage, and FF is the fill factor.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The polymer PDTP-DT2BT exhibits the highest PCE of 3.12% , ascribed to the largest J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 with a slightly lower V OC of 0.54 V and a slightly higher FF of 0.57 than the other polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 3.12% |
| 11.43 mA cm^-2 |
| 0.54 V |
| 0.57 |

The first entity, "3.12%", is the highest power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The second entity, "11.43 mA cm^-2", is the largest short-circuit current density (J SC) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The third entity, "0.54 V", is the open-circuit voltage (V OC) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The fourth entity, "0.57", is the fill factor (FF) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The second entity, "11.43 mA cm^-2", is the largest short-circuit current density (J SC) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The third entity, "0.54 V", is the open-circuit voltage (V OC) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.

The fourth entity, "0.57", is the fill factor (FF) of the polymer PDTP-DT2BT.
